item.description:
Let's get out for a heart-reving morning hike! Breakheart Reservation is a hidden jewel for local hiking, smaller than the Middlesex Fells but very diverse in terrain, as well as offering some great views.

 

What's the plan?

We will explore the Reservation's Ridge Trail, a rocky path that cuts across the more rugged portions of Breakheart. Total distance will be between five to six miles, the trail includes a generous amount of up/down climbing, as well as few rock scrambles. Our target pace is three mph or faster, with the goal of finishing the hike in under two hours. So a reasonable level of aerobic fitness is required. Come prepared to break a sweat!


Where will we meet?

We will be meeting at the Breakheart Reservation visitor parking lot in Saugus located on Forest Street. The actual address: 177 Forest Street Saugus 01906. Should be plenty of parking at that hour. 

Please be on time - most of us have to get to work eventually and if we start late, we'll finish late and mess up our schedules. I will leave the lot promptly at 5:35am. 


What should I bring?

Water (24 oz - 1 Liter), good hiking shoes/trail runners, bug spray

 

More Info:

Rain will cancel - I'll send out an email (with my cell phone number) to confirmed participants the night before the hike to confirm details.

For more information about Breakheart Reservation check out the offical DCR website: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/breakhrt.htm

 

Basic map overview map of Breakheart Trails (a little dated but still useful):

http://www.saugus.org/FOBR/maps/BreakheartMap.pdf

 

Directions:

From north or south: Take Rte. 1 to Lynn Fells Parkway exit, follow Lynn Fells Parkway a short distance, take a right onto Forest Street. Park entrance is after Kasabuski Rink.
item.name: Early Morning Hike - Breakheart Reservation
